name: Youngberg v. Romeo
question:
(1) Does the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment grant an involuntarily committed patient the right to safe confinement?

(2) Does the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment grant an involuntarily committed patient the right to freedom from bodily restraints?

(3) Does the Due Process Clause of the Fourteenth Amendment grant an involuntarily committed patient the right to adequate habilitation?
description: A case in which the Court held that the involuntarily committed do have liberty interests in safe confinement and freedom from bodily restraint under the Fourteenth Amendment.

name: Fair Assessment in Real Estate Assn., Inc. v. McNary

question:
Are the nonviolent elements of the petitionersâ€™ activities entitled to the protection of the First Amendment?

(1) If so, is a protest liable in damages caused by the nonviolent, protected activity?
description: A case in which the Court held that the NAACP's nonviolent protest was protected by the First Amendment.

question: Did the Immigration and Nationality Act, which allowed a one-House veto of executive actions, violate the separation of powers doctrine?
description: A case in which the Court held that the Immigration and Nationality Act violated the separation of powers by allowing a one-house veto over executive decisions.

name: Enmund v. Florida
question:
(1) Is death an unconstitutionally excessive and disproportionate penalty under the Eighth and Fourteenth Amendments for one who did not take a life, attempt to take a life, nor intend to take a life?

(2) Was petitioner's degree of participation in the killings given inadequate consideration by the Florida courts?

name: United States v. MacDonald
question: Was MacDonaldâ€™s Sixth Amendment right to a speedy trial violated by the gap between the 1972 CIDâ€™s report recommending further investigation into MacDonald and the re-filing of those same charges in 1975?
description: A case in which the Court MacDonaldâ€™s Sixth Amendment right to a speedy trial was not violated by the gap between the 1972 CIDâ€™s report recommending further investigation into MacDonald and the re-filing of those same charges in 1975.

name: Velde v. National Black Police Assn., Inc.
Insurance Corporation of Ireland, Ltd. v. Compagnie des Bauxites de Guinee
North Haven Bd. of Educ. v. Bell
question: Is Title IXâ€™s prohibition on gender discrimination in schools intended to cover the employees of schools?
description: A case in which the Court held that, while Title IX does not expressly include employees, Congressâ€™s choice of words, i.e. â€œno personâ€ as opposed to â€œstudentâ€ or â€œbeneficiaryâ€, implies an intention to broadly cover individuals involved in educational institutions rather than only students.

name: United States v. Louisiana (Louisiana Boundary Case)

description: A case in which the Court found that it was unconstitutional for the State to withhold funds from school districts educating children of illegal aliens.
